item.title: Creating Unique Sculpt Wear On A Trim Sheet (Pipeline Study) by Taylor Brandenburger
item.description:
I like to create my trims on a flat plane in substance painter. But how do you create sculpt grade level of detail thats... fast, flexible, and high quality? Let alone how do you do that on a plane? For some texture artist, its simple. Just launch up designer and begin sorting it out... Well thats not something I particularly want todo. I don't want to learn designer, Better yet I don't have time to learn designer. I want to take what I know (substance painter, anchors, filters) and conform it to what I need.

My pipeline breakdown is my approach on everything, identifying the problems of sculpt like detail in a production setting (time, budget, quality). And find something that can challenge all those things while keeping it purely in painter.

ZERO Additional maps needed! No weird custom channels. No weird addons, purely manipulating painter to work like designer for trims!

You can purchase here ~
Gumroad: https://gumroad.com/l/iZUKS
Artstation Store: https://artstn.co/m/7jqy

item.title: 2019 Women's World Cup France Set - Unreal Engine by Taylor Brandenburger
item.description:
https://www.artstation.com/dekogon

Check out Dekogon Studios latest project reveal!

I directed, managed, and built this scene with a team of talented artist to fullfill our friends over at FOX Sports ambitious request to recreate Paris for their FIFA Womens World Cup Broadcast.

item.title: Arcade Cabinet by Taylor Brandenburger
item.description:
Loved this pack! We made a Joystick and Button blueprint so all the buttons and joysticks can be animated (if desired). Also, every arcade cabinet that you purchase comes with its own custom animated start screen, you can enable or disable this feature (if desired)!

item.title: MGD-09 Programming Device by Taylor Brandenburger
item.description:
I saw Mike Garn's concept and I thought it was super cool and wanted to make a game ready version of it. I loved the functionality of the concept and how it felt futuristic yet grounded by its retro design.

I tried to stay true to the concept but ended up changing some things, for example the number pads have more of a rubber feel. The shape of the beveled buttons on the concept felt more like a hard plastic and not like rubber, so I wanted to change that. I also did this to help breakup the roughness values in the textures because everything was too similar in values. Also the concept is relativity polished so I wanted to stride away from that a tad bit. My main goal for texturing was to make the device feel old; but also looked like people still used it.

If you would like to look at more or Mike's works then check out his portfolio!
https://www.artstation.com/mikegarn
item.content:encoded:
I saw Mike Garn's concept and I thought it was super cool and wanted to make a game ready version of it. I loved the functionality of the concept and how it felt futuristic yet grounded by its retro design.

I tried to stay true to the concept but ended up changing some things, for example the number pads have more of a rubber feel. The shape of the beveled buttons on the concept felt more like a hard plastic and not like rubber, so I wanted to change that. I also did this to help breakup the roughness values in the textures because everything was too similar in values. Also the concept is relativity polished so I wanted to stride away from that a tad bit. My main goal for texturing was to make the device feel old; but also looked like people still used it.

If you would like to look at more or Mike's works then check out his portfolio!

item.title: Welding Station Prop by Taylor Brandenburger
item.description:
So my great friend offered me a service of mentoring me through a project, his project was to take my current skill (really shit) and make me super good, prior to this I had no pipeline and no knowledge of HP modeling (I was a noob). So he helped me for about 1 to 2 weeks, teaching me pipeline, technique, pbr materials & values, good clean bakes, HP modeling, letting smooth modifiers do the work for you, uv mapping, textile density, uv stacking, smart use of topology, basically the whole lot, I am great appreciative of his time and knowledge and not once he asked for money. Now its not like me to take advantage of this service without giving a donation, so I gave him a donation! I am a broke college student with little money but he deserved top dollar for his quality and service.

Dennis Porter (my mentor for this project)
http://www.dennisporter3d.com/
https://www.artstation.com/artist/bartalon
https://twitter.com/DennisPorter3D
